## Discussion

If this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/date] always rounds to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/minuteInterval] and only produces dates that align with the minute interval. If this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], changes to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/date] ignore the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/minuteInterval] property.

The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

# roundsToMinuteInterval

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that determines whether the date rounds to a specific minute interval.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var roundsToMinuteInterval: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

If this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/date] always rounds to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/minuteInterval] and only produces dates that align with the minute interval. If this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], changes to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/date] ignore the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/minuteInterval] property.

The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

## Configuring temporal attributes

- **maximumDate**: The maximum date that a date picker can show.
- **minimumDate**: The minimum date that a date picker can show.
- **minuteInterval**: The interval at which the date picker should display minutes.
- **countDownDuration**: The value displayed by the date picker when the mode property is set to show a countdown time.
